name: Bodyweight Push-ups
setup: Hands slightly wider than shoulder-width, fingers pointing forward
Body in straight line from head to heels
Core braced, shoulders packed down and back
steps: Lower chest toward floor, elbows tracking at 45° to body
Descend until chest is 1-2 inches from floor
Push through palms to return to start
Finish with shoulders packed, core tight
mistakes: Sagging hips or piking at waist
Partial range of motion (not reaching full depth)
safety: If shoulders or wrists hurt, elevate hands on a bench or wall. Avoid if experiencing elbow pain—regress to incline variation.

regressions: Incline push-ups (hands on bench or wall)
Eccentric-only push-ups (lower slow, reset at top)

prescriptionHints.notes: Great warm-up exercise at lower reps; hypertrophy finisher at higher reps to failure.

joints.notes: Keep shoulders packed and elbows at 45° to reduce shoulder stress. Use neutral grip handles or elevate hands if wrists are sensitive.
